item.title: Sir David Amess: MP murder suspect held under Terrorism Act
item.description: The man arrested over the killing of Sir David Amess is named as Ali Harbi Ali, a Briton of Somali heritage.

item.title: David Amess death: Priti Patel says MPs must be safe and accessible
item.description: The death of David Amess has raised questions about the contact between MPs and their constituents.

item.title: Prof Sarah Gilbert, Covid vaccine creator: Now let’s take on 12 more diseases
item.description: Prof Dame Sarah Gilbert says medical science has transformed ambitions for new vaccines.

item.title: Salisbury Plain soldier death: Jethro Watson-Pickering named by Army
item.description: Pte Jethro Watson-Pickering, 23, was part of a crew operating an Army vehicle at Salisbury Plain.

item.title: Haiti: US Christian missionaries kidnapped in Port-au-Prince - reports
item.description: At least 15 women, men and children were abducted by an armed gang near the capital, sources say.

item.title: Gas price rises: Russia not withholding supplies, says ambassador to UK
item.description: Russia is not slowing gas supplies for political reasons, Andrei Kelin says.

item.title: Sir David Amess: Southend city bid would be a 'fitting tribute' to stabbed MP
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel called him Mr Southend and said his passion for the town warmed hearts.

item.title: Robert Durst: US millionaire hospitalised with Covid after life sentence
item.description: Robert Durst was on Thursday convicted of murder and is a suspect in two other deaths.

item.title: Westfield Stratford closed after fire in first floor shop
item.description: The complex in east London is evacuated after the discovery of a small fire in a first-floor shop.

item.title: Southeastern train services taken over by government
item.description: The rail operator was stripped of its franchise for failing to declare millions in taxpayer funding.

item.title: Sudan: Protesters demand military coup as crisis deepens
item.description: The protests come as tensions rise between civilian and military rulers.

item.title: Macron condemns 'unforgivable' 1961 massacre of Algerians in Paris
item.description: The 1961 Paris massacre was denied or concealed by French governments for decades.

item.title: Venezuelan President Maduro's close aide extradited to US
item.description: Venezuela halted talks with the opposition after Alex Saab was flown from Cape Verde to the US.

item.title: The Papers: 'Terror will not win' and MP murder suspect named
item.description: Sunday's front pages are dominated by reaction to the killing of Conservative MP Sir David Amess.

item.title: Baby Loss Awareness Week: Two families’ stories
item.description: Steve and Laura Hughes open up about the pain of losing their son Jesse, who died in pregnancy.

item.title: Pigs at Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport help to keep skies safe
item.description: A team of 20 at Amsterdam's Schiphol Airport is part of a range of measures being used to reduce bird-strikes.

item.title: Breast cancer: 'Many men are oblivious they can get breast cancer'
item.description: Pat and Mark James both survived breast cancer, and want to warn "macho" men they could get it too.

item.title: Dormice favoured by Italian mafia seized in drugs raid
item.description: Italian police search a cannabis farm and seize a stash of 235 frozen dormice - a mafia delicacy.

item.title: Squid Game: The rise of Korean drama addiction
item.description: Finished Squid Game? Here's a quick lowdown on other K-dramas for new converts.

item.title: Ros Atkins on… China-Taiwan tensions
item.description: Ros Atkins examines why tensions between China and Taiwan have increased over recent weeks.

item.title: Life at 50C: Fleeing Sahara's shifting sands
item.description: Rising temperatures and desertification are forcing many Mauritanians to leave their ancestral homes.

item.title: Meghan Markle's donation a 'lifesaver' for community kitchen users
item.description: Money donated by the Duchess of Sussex has been spent on feeding Nottingham's most vulnerable.

item.title: Cardigan Bay dolphins may have high-pitch Welsh accent
item.description: The dolphins have been recorded making ultra-high pitch whistles off Cardigan Bay.

item.title: Cardiac arrest survivor urges people to learn CPR
item.description: A cardiac arrest survivor tells of his battle to live - and why learning CPR is so important.

item.title: Joy Crookes, her cats, and an album of soulful wisdom
item.description: The Brit Award-nominee discusses the making of her soul-searching debut album, Skin.

item.title: Apparently, it's the next big thing. What is the metaverse?
item.description: What does it mean, and what have Facebook and Fortnite got to do with it?

item.title: How a massacre of Algerians in Paris was covered up
item.description: French police killed up to 300 people in 1961, throwing some of them into the River Seine to drown them.

item.title: The Chinese film beating Bond and Marvel at the box office
item.description: The success of The Battle at Lake Changjin is bad news for Hollywood which wants to grow in China.

item.title: Channel smugglers step up risks to outfox France and UK
item.description: The number of migrants crossing has doubled in a year, so why is it proving so hard to stop their smugglers?

item.title: Sir David Amess killing: Security for politicians is a global dilemma
item.description: Why the need to be a people's representative and the need for personal safety are in constant conflict.

item.title: Adele Easy On Me: 'There's still a stigma about getting divorced when young'
item.description: For people who've been affected by divorce, Easy On Me is more than just another Adele ballad.

item.title: Shipping disruption: Why are so many queuing to get to the US?
item.description: A surge in demand for toys and sports equipment has contributed to logjams at US ports.

item.title: New database launched to counter extremism
item.description: The Extremist Monitoring Analysis Network aims to "combat hate speech and extremist ideologies".

item.title: Why giant turbines are pushing the limits of possibility
item.description: Huge wind turbines are pushing the limits of what ports and installation vessels can handle.

item.title: Christchurch: New Zealand city parts ways with its wizard
item.description: Christchurch was the only city in the world with its own official wizard.

item.title: Produce Pandas: The plus-size musicians making waves in China
item.description: As stars are criticised for being image-obsessed, more relatable celebrities have become popular.

item.title: Britain's Norrie reaches Indian Wells final with win over Dimitrov
item.description: Britain's Cameron Norrie reaches his first Masters 1,000 final at Indian Wells as he beats Bulgarian Grigor Dimitrov in straight sets.

item.title: Bruce has been the Newcastle 'fall guy', says son Alex
item.description: Steve Bruce has been the "fall guy" at Newcastle and it has been "really tough to watch" the criticism directed at him, says his son Alex Bruce.

item.title: Rory McIlroy: Northern Irishman storms into CJ Cup contention after superb 62
item.description: Rory McIlroy fires a 10-under-par 62 to move within two shots of leader Rickie Fowler after three rounds of the CJ Cup in Las Vegas.

item.title: What we know so far
item.description: What happened, what we know about the suspect, who the MP was, and what witnesses saw.

item.title: Sir David Amess killing: Should MPs still be able to meet the public?
item.description: The home secretary is reviewing MPs' security but says they must remain accessible to voters.

item.title: Candlelit vigil in honour of MP
item.description: Hundreds of people carrying lanterns and candles gathered in Leigh-on-Sea to pay their respects.

item.title: Sir David Amess killing casts shadow over Leigh-on-Sea constituency
item.description: Constituents in Leigh-on-Sea mourn Sir David Amess as they try to make sense of what happened.

item.title: Sir David Amess: How a tragic day unfolded
item.description: How constituents and authorities reacted to the tragic killing of Sir David Amess.

item.title: Boris Johnson pays tribute to Conservative MP Sir David Amess
item.description: Boris Johnson said Sir David Amess was one of the "kindest, nicest, most gentle people in politics".

item.title: Sir David Amess: Fun, friendly and always outspoken
item.description: The Tory MP was a backbencher of the old school who fought for the causes he cared about.

item.title: Sir David Amess: Political world pays tribute to much-loved MP
item.description: Sir David Amess has been described as "one of the kindest, most gentle people in politics".

item.title: 'David Amess was my best friend': Essex town in grief
item.description: Residents choke back tears on the streets of Leigh-on Sea as they remember their compassionate MP.

item.title: Sir David Amess: Boris Johnson leads tributes to much-loved MP
item.description: Friends and colleagues remember Essex MP David Amess's "wonderful smile" and "photographic memory".

item.title: Sir David Amess: 'We're utterly shocked and appalled', says parish priest
item.description: Leigh-on-Sea Parish Priest Kevin Hale reacts to the fatal stabbing of Sir David Amess MP.

item.title: Sir David Amess: Former Tory leader wants face to face meetings to continue
item.description: The former Tory leader says he doesn't want to change how MPs see constituents, despite the stabbing of Sir David Amess.

item.title: The mystery of how long Covid damages our memory
item.description: Since Chrissy Gibson was diagnosed with Covid-19, she has had to re-learn many aspects of her life.

item.title: New travel rules: What tests do I need and where is on the red list?
item.description: The number of red-list countries will be cut to just seven.

item.title: Super cold: Is 'the worst cold ever' going around?
item.description: As more of us mix and the weather gets colder, the common cold is back - and it's flooring people.

item.title: Covid: When will I get a booster jab?
item.description: More than two million people in England have had a third booster dose of Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: What's the 'Winter Plan' and what are the rules across the UK?
item.description: The Westminster and Cardiff governments have set out their plans to deal with Covid this winter.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The progress made in vaccinating the country's population, as more than 49 million people have received at least one dose.

item.title: Covid: What are the social distancing rules across the UK?
item.description: Social distancing rules are changing across the UK.

item.title: Can I get a free flu jab?
item.description: Health officials are urging millions of people to get a free flu vaccination before winter.

item.title: Covid: How do I get a lateral flow or PCR test?
item.description: Lateral flow tests are more accurate than first thought, according to new research.

item.title: Ivermectin: How false science created a Covid 'miracle' drug
item.description: Thousands worldwide have taken ivermectin to fight Covid. But what's the evidence?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings?
item.description: Face coverings could become a legal requirement in England again if the NHS struggles this winter.

item.title: Black scientists say UK research is institutionally racist
item.description: Senior black scientists tell the BBC they believe UK science to be "institutionally racist".

item.title: Drugs, arms, and terror: A high-profile defector on Kim's North Korea
item.description: A former colonel describes a leadership making cash by any means, from drug factories to illegal arms deals.

item.title: 'How I escaped a hidden world of gangs and exploitation'
item.description: Aliyah's smile conceals a lifetime of abuse - and experts warn her experience is all too common among a forgotten group of girls.

item.title: One of the darkest moments in Brazilian football - and the divide that still runs deep
item.description: A home Copa America in 1989 became a flashpoint in north-eastern Brazil's persistent struggles with prejudice and poverty.

item.title: The flood that drowned American dreams
item.description: Immigrant deaths in New York's floods lay bare the 'climate apartheid' wrought by extreme weather.
